description:
Despite what it says, this password manager does NOT clear the clipboard. It leaves your password ready to paste.

I'd say that makes the software unreliable, so I am deleting it.

In the year or so since I started using GNOME, I've come to appreciate having applications that blend in with the platform. Both in looks and function, an app that is tailored for the platform you use tends to provide a better experience than one that isn't.

Password Safe is one of those apps that is tailored for GNOME, and it benefits greatly from it. The HIG-compliant design makes for a great UX,
and the app never looks out of place on my desktop.

The app itself is very stable, and I can recommend it as a daily driver over cross-platform alternatives like Keepass/KeepassXC.
summary: A clean, stable, and integrated password manager for GNOME

description: Fantastic looking, simple and straight to the point app that is very easy to use.
It has a nice UI which integrates very well with gnome. But I found it to be quite unstable unlike what you should expect from such an important software
My only issue with it is that there is no *.deb package of it :(
Very well integrated with gnome. Working with Keepass DB is a killer feature!
The default instalation of this does not even run.
summary: Not launching on Fedora 31 KDE spin..

description:
It is at least 10 times slower in opening the database than Keepass(X(C)); this is a show stopper for me. Cannot wait ~>30s to open a wallet file.
I do love its interface though.
Another huge issue is that the search doesn't look in all the fields. I have a lot of old entries without a title. 
I think it should look in all fields beside password, but with priority (e.g Title, useername, description and all others). Maybe with a "More" button to keep it snappy.
summary: Awesome interface, but slow to open, and insufficient search

description:
I store my password database in Dropbox, so I can access it on my phone as well as on my laptop. I generally use KeePassXC. Yesterday I tried Password Safe. Today I discovered that my password file is 0 bytes long – its contents had been obliterated.

Fortunately I had a backup!

Intuitive to use, simple and flexible. Im not using it unfortunately because it has no expot capability. I had well over 300 hundred entries once in a password safe and the company made a decision I didnt want to go and I was stuck with removing every entry one at a time by hand. I swore Id never ever use a password safe that didnt have an export capability.
If you would like to manage your passwords using keepass this is one of the best applications.
summary: Excellent application, I recommend using it

description:
It seems to crash on it's own after a while. Also I thought it automatically saves stuff. One of these crashes lost two of my newly set up passwords. Good thing it was only two, otherwise this would be a one star.

The usability and UI design is simple and awesome though. Much preferred over KeePass, for example.
summary: Would be fantastic if it was stable

description: This is a nice little password manager for GNOME. Awesome looks, everything you need.

How to reproduce: 1- Create a safe, 2- Set it "password protected", 3- Try to open the safe. Then it freeze or crash. :(

Archlinux via package (not flathub).
Installed via Software app in Ubuntu. It doesn't honor the Dark Mode setting when set. (probably due to being installed as flatpak app) ?
summary: Great design, not respecting dark mode

description: While the original Keepass and its direct clones allowed to to quickly find entries in your database by searching for them this "Password Safe" searches return no results for entries clearly in the database.
summary: The limited and faulty search functionality makes it not usable for me

description: App take at least 2min to open safe after re-starting it.Considering the usual workflow with such app is re-opening it multiples times a day to acess the data and also the lack of integration with browsers make it hard to recommend over KeepassXC.
summary: Would not recommend in it current state

description: Won't close properly and after rebooting my machine, all the passwords were gone.
It looks neat, but unfortunately it's super slow when you have a lot of passwords compared to KeepassX(C)
summary: Best UI, worst performance among Keepass apps

description: I love this app, it has a great UI and uses a popular and secure file format. But I use firefox and I would love if it could auto-complete my passwords!
summary: Great app, but it needs integration with web browsers

description: At first I thought I had just forgotten to enter in my new password, but now I've realized that the application will delete passwords on occasion. As much as I would like to figure out what is causing the bug, I really don't want to lose any more passwords!
summary: Will lose passwords if you're not careful!

description: Design is appealing, but basic functionality that is generating a keyfile just hangs and never makes it.
the app looks nice but unlock speeds are too slow for me to use :/
good integration with gnome and compatibility with keepassxc
Generating keyfile hangs on Fedora 33
Simple and intuitive to use.
I wouldnt switch to it from keepassxc though
This is easy to use, the design is nice, fits all my needs, but the only reason that keeps me away from using it is OTP codes, it doesn't support them it seems..
summary: Perfect, but it needs OTP support!!

description:
I'm currently using another password manager, like LastPass.

The app itself is awesome! even uses libhandy! 

One improvement I would benefit from is to include the option for more databases, such as LastPass or Bitwarden, then I'd be using this app all the time!
summary: Great app, but I wish it allowed more databases

description:
it is relatively minimal compared to other GUI GTK based password-managers out there. this is a good thing since it minimizes the attack-surface from a sw vulnerability perspective. such minimal sw are always welcome even if the GUI front-end seems clunky sometimes and some functionality/integration with browsers could be missed from time-to-time.

if you know what you are doing and have imagination you could also use it to store other information such as contacts, bookmarks, etc.
worth its simplicity
The one I was finding for, clean, perfect and easy to use.
I like this app. I suppose the development was moved to the app called Secrets.
summary: Look for the app called: Secrets

description: Easy, safe instantly without risk of loosing anything. Nice clean interface and opens real fast. Totally recommend it.
summary: I have tried a lot of password apps and this one is one of the best!

description: It says it can import from a file but I'll be damned if I can find where.!!
Very useful app with a clean and simple UI design.
Just everything i need from a password manager
since latest Nov L5 update something was broken

....but this is a bad joke .... No info on what the things the program says that i should do ?!?!? made a "keesafe" (password locked folder?!?" great to have ... but then nothing ??? open "keyfile" where do i get that?? ¨ is it one of those authentificantion passskeys === `?
summary: Im new to this ubuntu and stuff...

description: Nice design and very useful

Schon zweimal hat dieses Programm meinen Kennwort-Datei zerschossen (Größe 0 Kb), de ich in der Google Cloud gespeichert hatte. Andere Apps unter Android IOS und Windows verwendeten diese Datei ohne sie zu beschädigen. Für eine App, die die Sicherheit erhöhen soll, extrem schwach.

Mir gefällt die Idee eine GNOME App zu diesem Zweck zu haben. Allerdings fehlt mir die Browser Integration (siehe KeePassXC) und die Verwendung des GTK Themes (ist immer Adwaita, egal was man im Tweak Tool eingestellt hat).
summary: Gute Idee aber zu wenig Funktionen

description:
Einfach zu bedienen, gute Funktionalität, Drag and Drop und
Integration in Browser wären gut.
Trotz guter Gnome Integration leider viel zu langsam.

Ich mag Programme, die sich gut in den Gnome Desktop einbinden, und das ist hier definitiv der Fall. Durch die Keepass-Kompatibilität habe ich meine Schlüssel sowohl auf dem Rechner als auch auf dem Handy. Die Bedienung ohne Maus ist etwas schwierig, da der Eingabefokus nicht optimal gesetzt ist. Auch sollte man sich an Standards halten, d.h. um z.B. ein Ebene zurückzugehen wurde BACKSPACE verwendet, was in Eingabefelder aber nicht funktioniert. Gnome Standard wäre ALT+UP.
Versionen vor 4 waren ziemlich langsam. 4.beta ist gerade bei größeren Datenbanken deutlich schneller.
Sin palabras, muy buena! :D

La version 2.4.6 de Keepass se me colgaba, tenia crashs, era complicado seguir usandola porque no podia copiar las contrasenias automaticamente. Esta aplicacion es super simple, rapida, toma la base de datos de keepass y permite hacer eso sin problemas... Hasta que se arregle el problema de Keepass es una alternativa genial. Gracias.

Es super bonita y ademas funcional, me sirve mucho para cordinarla con mi app de andriod, el unico detalle es que permitiría acceder a gdrive directamente y abrir o guardar allí, aprovechando el servicio de gnome como hace djadub o otras apps seria genial!.
Muy buena aplicacion, recomendado! solo falta una app p/ android para sincronizarlo.
Si se pudiera copiar user y password desde la primera vista, sin tener que acceder al secret, seria perfecta
Vraiment cool, sûr, très beau et fonctionnel.
Le meileur que j'ai pu trouver sous linux.
Cette application s'intègre parfaitement au bureau GNOME et est très élégante. Il ne manque qu'un système d'auto-complétion des mots de passe.
summary: Il ne manque que l'auto complétion des mots de passes

description:
S'intégre parfaitement au niveu visuel dans un environment GNOME.
L'interface s'adapte aussi sur les mobiles (Librem5, PinePhone) ce qui est un plus.

Venant de KeePassXC, il y a peut être moins de fonctionnalités disponibles mais les essentiels sont la et je l'utilise au quotidien.

Conforme à la description. Intégration parfaite dans l'environnement GNOME. Fluide, esthétique, efficace.
Néanmoins la navigation n'est pas pratique pour une base de données comportant un nombre élevé d'entrées, organisées en nombreux dossiers.
Absence de fonction de remplissage automatique, assez handicapante. 
J'aurais bien aimé continuer avec cette jolie interface mais je n'ai d'autre choix que de m'en retourner à KeePassDX.
summary: ne convient pas à une grande base de données

description:
Très stable et bien intégrée dans l'environnement GNOME. Mais ses lacunes par rapport à keepassxc en font une appli de second choix :
- Pas de support pour l'OTP
- Manque de raccourcis claviers

Hormis ça, très bonne appli merci aux développeurs pour leur travail.
Exactement ce qu'il me fallait
可以和 keepass 一同使用
